title: Rivian Pops, but EVs Flop at Glasgow Climate Summit
sub_head: Failure of COP26 to deliver a widely supported EV pledge may be early sign that debate around autos is getting more sophisticated
body:
Investors love electric vehicles. Others may be starting to have slightly mixed feelings.
Rivian shares rose 29% on their maiden trading day Wednesday even after the EV startup priced its initial public offering 31% higher than the midpoint of a range given only last week. Despite delivering a total of just 156 vehicles by the end of October, nearly all of them to employees, the company received a fully diluted market value of almost $100 billionâ€”more than Detroit stalwarts Ford and General Motors .
